places_to_visit.name: Old City
places_to_visit.description: The Old City of Jerusalem is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and home to key religious landmarks including the Western Wall, the Church of the Holy Sepulchre, and the Dome of the Rock. It is divided into quarters for Jewish, Christian, Muslim, and Armenian communities.

places_to_visit.name: Yad Vashem
places_to_visit.description: Yad Vashem is Israel's official memorial to the victims of the Holocaust. The complex includes a museum, memorials, and a research center dedicated to preserving the memory of the Holocaust.

places_to_visit.name: Mount of Olives
places_to_visit.description: The Mount of Olives offers panoramic views of Jerusalem and is a significant site in Christianity, Judaism, and Islam. Key sites include the Church of All Nations, the Jewish Cemetery, and the Garden of Gethsemane.

places_to_visit.name: Israel Museum
places_to_visit.description: The Israel Museum in Jerusalem is the country's premier cultural institution, housing a vast collection of archaeology, fine arts, and Jewish art. Highlights include the Dead Sea Scrolls and the Model of Jerusalem in the Second Temple Period.

places_to_visit.name: Mahane Yehuda Market
places_to_visit.description: Mahane Yehuda is a bustling market in Jerusalem offering a wide range of fresh produce, spices, and local delicacies. It's a great place to experience local flavors and vibrant market life.
